thread.title: Dawgs look to vault themselves into playoff talk with win over Alabama
thread.title_full: Dawgs look to vault themselves into playoff talk with win over Alabama

author: Wesley Goheen
title: Dawgs look to vault themselves into playoff talk with win over Alabama
text:
Dawgs look to vault themselves into playoff talk with win over A - WTVM.com-Columbus, GA News Weather & Sports Member Center: Dawgs look to vault themselves into playoff talk with win over Alabama Posted: Updated: Friday, October 2 2015 5:49 AM EDT 2015-10-02 09:49:42 GMT Ahead of Saturday’s big game against the University of Alabama, Georgia students were notified that parking plans have changed. More >> Ahead of Saturday’s big game against the University of Alabama, Georgia students were notified that parking plans have changed. More >> Updated: Tuesday, September 29 2015 11:28 AM EDT 2015-09-29 15:28:12 GMT Despite losing to Mississippi in the third game of the season, the Alabama Crimson Tide have been ranked ahead of an undefeated Georgia Bulldog team in the College Football Computer Composite Super 16 poll. More >> Despite losing to Mississippi in the third game of the season, the Alabama Crimson Tide have been ranked ahead of an undefeated Georgia Bulldog team in the College Football Computer Composite Super 16 poll. More >> ATHENS, GA (CBS46) - 
The Georgia Bulldogs can take a major step on the road to the 2016 College Football Playoff with a win over Alabama at Sanford Stadium in Athens on Saturday. 
The undefeated Bulldogs host the Crimson Tide in a huge SEC match-up that will go a long way in determining what four teams will be left standing in order to play for the NCAA Championship. 
The Bulldogs are looking for revenge against 'Bama after falling to the Tide, 32-28 in the 2012 SEC Championship Game. Alabama went on to win the National Championship by beating Notre Dame in the BCS Championship Game. 
Georgia hasn't beaten Alabama since 2007, when the Dawgs beat the Tide 26-23 in Tuscaloosa. 
Alabama leads the all-time series 37-25-4, although Georgia won three straight in the series in 2002, 2003 and 2007. The Tide have won the last two match-ups. 
Alabama also leads the series 14-10 in games played in Athens. The Tide are 12-8 all-time between the hedges at Sanford Stadium. The teams were 2-2 against each other in games played at Georgia's previous stadium, Herty Field. Sanford Stadium was opened in 1929. 
Dawgs Road to SEC Championship Game Gets Easier With Win 
If Georgia is to beat Alabama on Saturday, they'll face tough road games at Tennessee on October 10 and at Auburn on November 14. The Bulldogs will also play their cross-state rival Georgia Tech in a non-conference game on November 28. Georgia also has home games against Missouri, Florida, Kentucky at Georgia Southern. 
Alabama Still Faces Tough Road Even In Victory Over Dawgs 
Alabama, despite losing to Mississippi on September 19, is still ranked ahead of Georgia in this week's College Football Computer Composite Poll. Alabama is rated third. A panel will determine which four teams will play in the four-team College Football Playoff. Georgia is ranked 9th. 
If Alabama wins on Saturday, they still face tough road games at Texas A&M, Mississippi State and Auburn. The Tide also host Arkansas, Tennessee, LSU and Charleston Southern. 
Watch All The Action On CBS46 
Saturday's game will kick-off at 3:30 p.m. at Sanford Stadium in Athens. You can watch all the action on CBS46. The Bulldogs are favored by 2.5 points. 
Copyright 2015 WGCL-TV (Meredith Corporation). All rights reserved. YOUR TURN ON 9 Who do you think will win Saturday's match-up between Alabama and Georgia? Roll Tide! 
Thank you for participating in our poll. Here are the results so far: Roll Tide!
